comments.text:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:5.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/5.0
Build ID: 20110615151330

Steps to reproduce:

Tried to set top and left css properties on style attribute for <panel> XulElement.


Actual results:

Nothing


Expected results:

Should have adjusted the top and left.

Additional Info: I have written a 'resize by any corner or border' JS object for <panel> and I am attempting to set the new correct top, left, width, height in one call to avoid extra redrawing.  The best way I could do this was to set the top/left/width/height via the style attribute.  The style attribute does honor the width and height, but not the top and left.

If there were an alternate way to both move and resize an element (floating <panel>) or suspend drawing for a few lines, that would work too.

In the end though, the top and left should be honored via the style attribute anyways.
